subject: p10268877
History: -year-old male with left lower lobe pneumonia, evaluate for change.
Findings: An endotracheal tube, NG tube, and right upper extremity PICC with its tip at the cavoatrial junction are unchanged. There is no change in left lower lobe opacity. There is no large pleural effusion, or pneumothorax. The cardiac silhouette remains moderately enlarged, mediastinal contours are notable for calcification of the aortic arch.
Impression: Mild residual retrocardiac opacification remains, pneumonia vs. Atelectasis.
